alert.note: Alert for Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:35PM CDT until March 25 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN RANKIN...NORTHEASTERN SIMPSON AND NORTHWESTERN SMITH COUNTIES... At 635 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Cato, or near Mendenhall, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Johns around 640 PM CDT. White Oak around 650 PM CDT. Burns around 700 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Polkville and Puckett. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
